meanings.definition: A transaction in which a company sells an asset and then leases it back from the buyer.
meanings.sent1: The leaseback of the office building allowed the company to free up capital for other investments.
meanings.sent2: The leaseback agreement was beneficial for both parties involved in the deal.
meanings.sent3: When the building started charging rent to the company, it felt like a leaseback loop!
meanings.sent4: The leaseback arrangement was like a financial dance between the company and the buyer.
meanings.sent5: The concept of leaseback is like renting your own property after selling it.

meanings.definition: To engage in a leaseback transaction.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to leaseback the equipment to maintain operational flexibility.
meanings.sent2: They chose to leaseback the machinery rather than purchasing it outright.
meanings.sent3: Leasebacking the vehicle seemed like a smart move at the time.
meanings.sent4: She leasebacked the property to ensure a steady income stream.
meanings.sent5: To leaseback is to sell and rent back, a common practice in business transactions.
